sentence: The medium farthest removed from language.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Before proceeding to the first question, however, I would call the reader’s attention to something that affects the final solution to my problem.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It is not always the case that the most abstract medium has as its object the most abstract idea.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Thus although the medium used by the architect is the most abstract, the ideas brought to light in architecture are not at all the most abstract.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Architecture bears a much closer relation to history than does, for example, sculpture.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Yet another choice now presents itself.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In our order of ranking I can place in the first class those works whose medium is the most abstract or those whose idea is the most abstract.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Here I select the idea, not the medium.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Of course abstract media are the prerogative of sculpture and painting and music as well as architecture.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This is not the place to pursue that question.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The most abstract idea conceivable is the spirit of sensuality.7 But in what medium can it be represented?
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Only in music.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It cannot be represented in sculpture, for in itself it is a kind of quality of inwardness.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It cannot be painted, for it cannot be grasped in fixed contours; it is an energy, a storm, impatience, passion, and so on, in all their lyrical quality, existing not in a single moment but in a succession of moments, for if it existed in a single moment it could be portrayed or painted.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Its existing in a succession of moments indicates its epic character, yet in a stricter sense it is not an epic, for it has not reached the level of words; it moves constantly in an immediacy.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Nor can it be represented, therefore, in poetry.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The only medium that can represent it is music.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: For music has an element of time in it yet it does not lapse in time except in an unimportant sense.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: What it cannot express is the historical in time.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: We have the perfect unity of this idea and its corresponding form in Mozart’s Don Giovanni.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Mozart’s good fortune was to get hold of a subject that is in itself absolutely musical, and were any other composer to vie with Mozart, all he could do would be to compose Don Giovanni over again.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Homer found a perfect epic subject, but one can imagine many epic poems because history has more epic material to offer.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: That is not the case with Don Giovanni.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: What I really mean by this can perhaps best be grasped by pointing to the difference with a related idea.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Goethe’s Faust is a genuine classic, the idea is an historical one, and so every significant historical age will have its Faust.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Faust has language as its medium, and the fact that language is a far more concrete medium is another reason why several works of the same kind can be imagined.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Don Giovanni, on the other hand, is and will remain the only one of its kind, just as the classic sculptures of Greece.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But since the idea in Don Giovanni is far more abstract even than that underlying sculpture, one sees easily why we have just one work in music but several in sculpture.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: One can indeed imagine many more musical classics, yet there still remains just one work of which it can be said that its idea is absolutely musical, so that the music does not enter as an accompaniment but, in bringing the idea to light, reveals its own innermost being.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Therefore Mozart with his Don Giovanni stands highest among the immortals.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But now I shall abandon this whole inquiry.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It is written only for those in love.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: And just as it takes little to please a child, everyone knows how the most curious things can bring pleasure to people in love.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It is like a heated lovers’ quarrel over nothing, which nevertheless has its worth – for the lovers.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Although the above remarks have tried in every possible way, conceivable and inconceivable, to secure acknowledgement of Mozart’s Don Giovanni as first among all classics, virtually no attempt has been made to prove that it is indeed a classic.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: I admit that to do that would be a very appropriate introduction to the real inquiry  but it could never occur to me to undertake that task, however easily it might come to me.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But since I shall all the time be assuming the matter to be beyond question, the sequel will offer many opportunities for, and ways of, shedding light on Don Giovanni in this respect, just as what has gone before held several hints.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The task this inquiry has really set itself is to show the significance of the musical erotic, and to that end to indicate in turn the different stages which, all sharing the property of being immediately erotic, agree also in all being essentially musical.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: What I have to say on this score I owe to Mozart alone.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: So should anyone be civil enough to concede that I am right in what I say, but have some doubts as to how far what I say relates to Mozart’s music or to what I read into it, I can assure him that he will find in the music not only the little that I contrive to present here but infinitely more; indeed, I can assure him that this is precisely the thought that makes me so bold as to hazard an explanation of particular features of Mozart’s music.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: What someone has loved with the infatuation and admired with the enthusiasm of youth, what someone has kept up a clandestine and enigmatic commerce with in his innermost soul, what someone has hidden away in his heart, that is something the like of which one always approaches with a certain shyness, with mixed feelings, when one knows that the intention is to try to understand it.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: What you have learned to know bit by bit, like a bird gathering every little straw, happier over each small piece than over all the rest of the world; what the loving ear has absorbed, solitary in the great multitude, unremarked in its secret place of hiding; what the greedy ear has snatched up, never gratified, the miserly ear hidden, never secure, that whose softest echo has never deceived the searching ear’s sleepless vigil; what you have lived by day, relived by night, what has banished sleep and made it troubled; what you have dreamt of in sleep, what you have woken up to dream of again when awake, what caused you to leap up in the middle of the night for fear of forgetting it; what has come to you in your moments of greatest rapture; what like a woman’s embroidery you keep constantly beside you; what has followed you on the clear moonlit nights, in lonely forests by the shores, in the gloomy streets, in the dead of night, at break of day, what has ridden with you on horseback, accompanied you in the carriage, what permeates your home, what your chamber has been witness to, what has echoed in your ear, resounded through your soul, what your soul has spun into its finest web – that now reveals itself to thought.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: As those mysterious beings in ancient tales rise from the ocean bed invested in seaweed, so it now rises up from the sea of remembrance interwoven with memories.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The soul becomes sad and the heart soft, for it is as though one bade it farewell, were parting from it never to meet again, either in time or eternity.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: One feels as though unfaithful, that one has broken one’s covenant, one feels one is no longer the same, not as young, not as childlike; one fears for oneself in case one loses what has made one glad and happy and rich; one fears for what one loves lest it suffer with this change, perhaps prove less perfect, that possibly it will be at a loss for answers to the many questions; and then, alas!
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: all is lost, the spell is gone, and never more can it be evoked.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: As regards Mozart’s music, my soul knows no fear, my confidence no bounds.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In part this is because what I have understood so far is so very little and there will always be enough left over hiding in the shadows of presentiment; partly because I am convinced that if Mozart ever became wholly comprehensible to me, he would for the first time become wholly incomprehensible to me.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: To maintain that Christianity has brought sensuality into the world seems boldly venturesome.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But nothing ventured, nothing gained, as the saying is, and that goes here too, as will be apparent when one considers that in positing something one indirectly posits the other thing which one excludes.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Since sensuality in general is what is negated, it first comes into view, is first posited, through the act that excludes it by positing the opposite, positive principle.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: As a principle, a power, a system in itself, sensuality was first posited with Christianity, and to that extent Christianity has introduced sensuality to the world.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: However, if one wishes properly to understand the proposition that Christianity has introduced sensuality to the world, it must be understood identically with its opposite, that it is Christianity that has chased sensuality out, kept it out of the world.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: As a principle, a power, a system in itself, sensuality was first posited with Christianity.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: I could add a further qualification which perhaps makes my meaning most clear: it was Christianity that first posited sensuality under the category of spirit.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: That is quite natural, for Christianity is spirit, and spirit the positive principle it has introduced to the world.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But when sensuality is considered under the category of spirit, one sees that its significance is that it is to be excluded; but it is precisely by the fact that it is to be excluded that it is defined as a principle, as a power; for what spirit, itself a principle, is to exclude must be something appearing in the form of a principle even though it only appears as a principle the moment it is excluded.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: That sensuality has existed before Christianity would naturally be a very foolish objection, for it is self-evident that what is to be excluded always pre-exists what excludes it, even if in another sense it first comes into existence through its exclusion.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This is due, again, to its coming into existence in another sense, and that is why I said at the start: nothing ventured, nothing gained.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Sensuality has indeed existed previously, but not defined spiritually.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In what manner then has it existed?
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It has existed under the category of soul.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: That is how it existed in paganism and if one is looking for the most perfect expression of it, that is how it existed in Greece.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But under the category of soul, sensuality is not opposition, exclusion, but harmony and accord.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Precisely because sensuality is posited under the category of harmony, however, it is not posited as a principle but as an assonant enclitic.8 The importance of this consideration is to cast light on the different forms assumed by the erotic in the different steps in the development of the world-consciousness, and so to lead us towards a definition of the immediate erotic as identical with the musical erotic.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In the Greek consciousness, sensuality was under control in the beautiful individual, or more properly, it was not under control for it was not indeed an enemy that had to be subdued, a dangerous rebel to be kept in check; it was given freedom of life and joy in the beautiful individual.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Sensuality, consequently, was not posited as a principle; the quality of soul that constituted the beautiful individual was inconceivable without the sensual; for that reason neither was sensually based eroticism posited as a principle.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Sensual love was everywhere as an element, and present elementally in the beautiful individual.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The gods knew its power no less than men; the gods no less than men knew their happy and unhappy love affairs.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In none of them, however, is love present as a principle; in so far as it existed in them, in the individual, it was present as an element of love’s universal power, which however was present nowhere, and therefore not even for the Greek conception or in the Greek consciousness.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It might be objected that Eros was, after all, the god of love; so it must be possible to imagine love present as a principle at least in him.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But apart from the fact that here again love does not depend on the erotic, in the sense of deriving from the sensual alone, but on qualities of the soul, there is another factor to note which I shall now go into more closely.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Eros was the god of love but was not in love himself.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In so far as the other gods and men sensed the power of love in themselves, they attributed this to Eros, referred it to him, but Eros was not himself in love; and the fact that it did happen to him once9 must be considered an exception; in spite of being the god of love, he lagged far behind the other gods in the number of his adventures, and far behind men.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Indeed, that he did fall in love amounts to saying that he too yielded to the universal power of love, which became in a way a power outside him, and which, being turned away from him, had no place of its own where one could seek it.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: And his love is not based on sensuality but on qualities of soul.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It is a genuinely Greek thought that the god of love is not himself in love while all others owe it to him that they are.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Were I to imagine a god or a goddess of longing, it would be genuinely Greek to suppose that while all who felt the sweet unrest or pain of longing referred it to this being, this being itself had no feeling of longing.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: I know no better way of describing the remarkable nature of this relation than by saying that it is the converse of representation.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In the relation of representation all the energy is gathered in a single individual and the particular individuals share in him to the extent that they share in his particular movements.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: I might also say, this relation is the converse of that upon which the Incarnation is based.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In the Incarnation the individual has the whole of life’s fullness within him and the other individuals only have access to this from beholding it in the incarnated individual.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In the Greek relationship, the opposite is the case.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: What makes for the power of the god is not in the god but in all the other individuals who refer it to him; it is as though he himself were powerless, impotent, because he communicates his energy to all the rest of the world.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The incarnated individual as it were sucks in the energy from all the others and the fullness is then in him and only for the others to the extent that they behold it in that individual.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This will have consequences for what follows, just as it is important in itself with regard to the categories which the world-consciousness uses in different epochs.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Sensuality as a principle is not to be found in the Greek consciousness, nor do we find the erotic as a principle based on the principle of the sensual; and even if we had found that, we still see – and this is of the greatest importance for this inquiry – that the Greek consciousness lacks the strength to concentrate the whole in a single individual but lets the whole radiate to all the others from a point which lacks it, so that really this constitutive point is to be identified by its being the only point which lacks what it gives to all others.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Sensuality as a principle, then, is posited with Christianity, and similarly the sensual erotic as a principle.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The idea of representation was introduced to the world by Christianity.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: If I imagine the sensual erotic as a principle, as a power, as a realm characterized by spirit, that is to say characterized by being excluded by spirit, if I imagine it concentrated in a single individual, then I have the concept of the spirit of the sensual erotic.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This is an idea which the Greeks did not have, which Christianity first introduced to the world, if only in an indirect sense.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: If this spirit of the sensual erotic in all its immediacy demands expression, the question is: what medium lends itself to that?
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: What must be especially borne in mind here is that it demands expression and representation in its immediacy.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In its mediate state and its reflection in something else it comes under language and becomes subject to ethical categories.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In its immediacy it can only be expressed in music.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: On this score I must ask the reader to recall what was said about this in the platitudinous introduction.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This is where the significance of music is revealed in its full validity, and in a stricter sense it also reveals itself as a Christian art, or rather as the art which Christianity posits by shutting it out, as the medium for what Christianity shuts out and thereby posits.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In other words, music is the demonic.10 In the erotic sensual genius, music has its absolute object.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This of course by no means implies that music cannot express other things, but this is nevertheless its proper object.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Similarly, the art of sculpture can represent much more than human beauty, and yet this is its absolute object; painting can represent much more than celestially transfigured beauty, and still this is its absolute object.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The important thing in this respect is to be able to see the concept in each art, and not let oneself be put off by what it can do besides.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Man’s concept is spirit and we must not allow ourselves to be put off by the fact that he is also able to walk on two legs.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Language’s concept is thought, and we must not let ourselves be put off by the view of certain sensitive people that its greatest significance is to produce inarticulate sounds.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Here I beg to be allowed a little platitudinous interlude; praeterea censeo,11 that Mozart is the greatest among classical composers, and that his Don Giovanni deserves the highest place among all classic works of art.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Now regarding the nature of music as a medium, this will naturally always be a very interesting problem.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Whether I am able to say anything adequate on the matter is another question.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: I am well aware that I have no understanding of music.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: I freely admit that I am a layman.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: I do not hide the fact that I am not one of those select people who possess musical expertise, that I am at most a proselyte of the gate,12 whom a strangely irresistible impulse carried from afar to this point but no further.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: And yet it could be that the little I have to say contained some particular remark which, if it met with favour and indulgence, might be found to contain some truth even if it concealed itself under a shabby coat.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: I stand outside music and from this standpoint I observe it.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: That this standpoint is very imperfect I freely admit; that I am able to see very little in comparison with those fortunate people who stand inside I do not deny; but I still continue to hope that from my standpoint I too may be able to impart some odd piece of enlightenment on the subject, although the initiated could do it much better – yes, to some extent even understand what I say better than I do myself.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: If I were to imagine two countries bordering on each other, with one of which I was fairly familiar and with the other was quite unfamiliar, and I was not allowed to enter that unknown realm however much I wanted to, I should still be able to form some conception of it.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: I would travel to the boundaries of the kingdom I knew and follow them constantly, and as I did so my movements would describe the contours of that unknown land; in this way I would form a general idea of it even though I had never set foot in it.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: And if this was a task that greatly occupied me, and if I was indefatigable in my accuracy, it would no doubt sometimes happen that, as I stood sadly at my own country’s boundary and looked longingly into that unknown land which was so near me and yet so far, some little revelation might fall to my lot.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: And although I feel that music is an art which requires experience to a high degree to justify one’s having an opinion about it, still I comfort myself again, as so often, with the paradox that there is experience to be gained in presentiment and in ignorance.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: I comfort myself by remembering that Diana, who had not herself given birth, nevertheless came to the assistance of the childbearing woman; indeed that she had this as a native gift from childhood so that she came to Latona’s assistance in her labour when she herself was born.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The country known to me, to whose furthest boundaries I intend to go in order to discover music, is language.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: If one wants to arrange the different media according to a definite order of development, one must place music and language next to each other; for which reason it has also been said that music is a language, which is more than just a brilliant remark.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: If one liked indulging in brilliance one could say that sculpture and painting, too, are a kind of language, in so far as every way of expressing an idea is always a language, since language is the essence of the idea.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Brilliant people talk, therefore, of the language of nature, and maudlin clergymen now and then open up the book of nature for us to read something which neither they nor their hearers understand.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: If the remark that music is a language was in no better shape than this, I should not question it but let it pass and count for what it is.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But that is not how it is.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It is only when spirit is posited that language comes into its rights; but when spirit is posited, everything that is not spirit is excluded.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But this exclusion is a qualification of spirit, and to the degree, then, that what is excluded is to assert itself it needs a spiritually qualified medium, and this is music.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But a medium which is spiritually determined is essentially language; then since music is spiritually determined, it has justly been called a language.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: As a medium, language is the one absolutely spiritually qualified medium; it is therefore the proper medium for the idea.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: To elaborate this point in more detail goes beyond both my competence and the scope of this little inquiry.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Just one remark, however, which again brings me back to music.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In language the sensual is, as medium, reduced to the level of mere instrument and constantly negated.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Such is not the case with the other media.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Neither in sculpture nor in painting is the sensual a mere instrument but an integral part, nor is it constantly negated, for it must continually be part of what is seen.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It would be a peculiarly perverted way of looking at a statue or a painting to ignore the sensual aspect, thus completely rescinding its beauty.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In sculpture, architecture, painting, the idea is bound up with the medium; but this fact that the idea neither reduces the medium to the level of mere instrument, nor constantly negates it, is as it were an expression of the fact that that medium cannot speak.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: So too with nature.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Therefore we rightly say that nature is dumb, and architecture and sculpture and painting; we say it rightly in spite of all those fine-tuned, sensitive ears that can hear them speak.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It is therefore idiocy to say that nature is a language, as it is inept to say that the mute is vocal, since it is not even a language in the sense in which sign-language is.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But with language it is different.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The sensual is reduced to mere instrument and thus rescinded.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: If when a man spoke one heard the movements of his tongue, etc., he would speak badly; if when he heard, he heard the air vibrations instead of the words, he would hear badly; if when reading a book one constantly saw the individual letters, one would read badly.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Language becomes the perfect medium just at the moment when everything sensual is negated in it.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: So also with music; what should really be heard constantly emancipates itself from the sensual.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: That music, as a medium, does not stand as high as language has already been pointed out, and that is also why I said that only in a certain sense was music a language.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Language makes its appeal to the ear.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: No other medium does that.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The ear is the most spiritually determined of the senses.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This I believe most people will admit.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Should anyone wish further information on this point, I refer him to the preface of Karikaturen des Heiligsten by Steffens.13 Beside language, music is the only medium that addresses the ear.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In this we have yet another analogy and testimony to the way in which music is a language.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: There is much in nature which addresses itself to the ear but what affects the ear is the purely sensual, and therefore nature is dumb.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: And it is a ridiculous fancy that one hears something because one hears a cow moo or, what has perhaps a larger claim in this respect, a nightingale sing; it is mere imagination to think that one hears something, mere imagination that the one is worth more than the other, for it’s all six of one and half a dozen of the other.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Language has time as its element; all other media have space as their element.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Only music also takes place in time, but the fact that it takes place in time is again a negation of the sensual.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: With products of the other arts, their sensual character indicates precisely that they have their existence in space.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Now, of course, again there is much in nature that takes place in time.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Thus when a brook murmurs and continues to murmur it seems to have the character of time.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: However, that is not so, and were one to insist that there was this character of time, one would have to say that although it was there, it was present in a spatialized way.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Music exists only in the moment of its performance, for however skilful one may be at reading notes and however lively one’s imagination, it cannot be denied that it is only in an unreal sense that the music exists when read.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It exists really only when it is performed.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This might seem to be an imperfection in this art as compared with the others, whose works constantly endure because they have their existence in the sensual.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Yet that is not so.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Rather it is a proof that music is a higher, a more spiritual art.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: If I begin with language, in order, by moving through it, to as it were hear my way towards music, the matter appears to be roughly as follows.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: If I assume that prose is the language-form farthest removed from music, then I detect already in the oratorical style of delivery, in the sonorous structure of periods, a suggestion of the musical which comes more and more strongly to the fore through different levels in the poetic style, in the structure of the verse, in the rhyme, until at last the musical has developed so strongly that language ceases and everything becomes music.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This latter is indeed a favourite expression of the poets, who use it to indicate that in a way they disown the idea, the idea drops out of their view, everything ends in music.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This might seem to indicate that music is an even more perfect medium than language.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: However, that is one of those mawkish misunderstandings which originate only in empty heads.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: That it is a misunderstanding will be shown later; here I would only draw attention to the remarkable circumstance that by moving through language in the opposite direction I again come up against music; that is, when I proceed downward from conceptpermeated prose until I land in interjections which again are musical, just as the child’s first babbling is musical.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Here, however, it could hardly be said that music is a more perfect medium than language, or that music is a richer medium than language, unless one takes saying ‘ugh!’ to be worth more than a whole thought.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But what follows from this – that wherever language comes to an end, I run into the musical?
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Surely, it is the most perfect expression of the idea that music always sets limits to language.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: One sees in addition how this is connected with the misunderstanding that music is a richer medium than language.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In saying that when language stops, music begins, and in saying, as people do, that everything is musical, we are not going onwards but back.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: That is why I have never had any sympathy – and here perhaps even the experts will agree with me – for that purified music which thinks it can do without words.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: For as a rule it thinks of itself as being above the word, in spite of being its inferior.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Now one might object as follows: ‘If it is true that language is a richer medium than music, it is incomprehensible why it should be so hard to give an aesthetic account of the musical, incomprehensible that language should always prove in this connection a poorer medium than music.’ However, it is neither incomprehensible nor beyond explanation.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: For music always expresses the immediate in its immediacy.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: That is also why in relation to language music comes first and last; but from this one also sees it is a misunderstanding to say that music is a more perfect medium.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In language there is reflection and therefore language cannot express the immediate.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Reflection kills the immediate and that is why it is impossible to express the musical in language; but this apparent poverty of language is precisely its wealth.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: For the immediate is the indeterminable and so language cannot apprehend it, but the fact that it is indeterminable is not its perfection but a defect.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This is indirectly acknowledged in many ways.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Thus to cite but one example, we say: ‘I can’t really explain why I do this or that, in this way or that; I do it by ear.’ In connection with things bearing no relation to music we frequently use a word taken from music, but what we indicate by its use is the obscure, the unaccountable, the immediate.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Now if the immediate, qualified spiritually, is what is properly expressed in music, one may ask again, more explicitly, what species of the immediate is essentially music’s object.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The immediate, qualified spiritually, can be specified as falling either within the sphere of the spiritual or outside it.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: When the immediate, qualified spiritually, is specified as falling within the sphere of the spiritual, it can well find its expression in the musical, but this immediacy cannot be music’s absolute object, for so specifying it as to include it within the spiritual suggests that music is in a sphere foreign to it; it forms a constantly cancelled prelude.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But if the immediate, qualified spiritually, is so specified as to fall outside the spiritual, we have then music’s absolute object.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: For the former species of the immediate it is not essential that it be expressed in music but essential for it to become spirit, and accordingly to be expressed in language.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: For the latter it is, on the contrary, essential that it be expressed in music, it cannot be expressed other than in music, it cannot be expressed in language, since spiritually it is so specified as to fall outside the spiritual and accordingly outside language.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But the immediacy thus excluded by the spirit is sensual immediacy.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This belongs to Christianity.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In music it has its absolute medium, and from this can also be explained the fact that music was not properly developed in antiquity but belongs to the Christian era.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Music is, then, the medium for that species of the immediate which, qualified spiritually, is specified as lying outside spirit.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Naturally, music can express much else, but this is its absolute object.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It is also easy to see that music is a more sensual medium than language, much more stress being placed here on the sensual sound than in language.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Sensual genius is thus music’s absolute object.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Sensual genius is absolutely lyrical, and in music it breaks out in all its lyrical impatience, for it is qualified spiritually and is therefore power, life, movement, constant unrest, continual succession.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But this unrest, this succession, does not enrich it; its spirit remains always the same, it does not develop but rages on uninterrupted as if in a single breath.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Were I to characterize this lyrical quality with a single predicate, I might say: ‘It sounds.’ And that takes me back once more to the spirit of sensuality as what manifests itself immediately in music.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: I realize that even I could say considerably more on this point.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: I acknowledge that it would be an easy matter for the experts to make a much better job of clarifying it.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: But since no one, as far as I know, has made the attempt or even a show of doing so, since they all continue to repeat that Mozart’s Don Giovanni is the crown of all operas but without elaborating on what they mean by that, although they all say it in a way that clearly shows they mean to say more than just that Don Giovanni is the best opera, that there is a qualitative difference between it and all other operas which is nevertheless not to be found in the absolute relation between idea, form, subject-matter and medium; since, I say, that is so, then I have broken the silence.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Maybe I have been a little too hasty, maybe I would have succeeded in saying it better had I waited yet a while; I do not know.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: So there is an opportunity, once again, to see in what sense I can call the preceding ‘stages’ by that name when I call the third stage Don Giovanni.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: I have already reminded you that they have no separate existence, and when one takes this third stage, which is really the whole stage, as one’s point of departure, they are less easily seen as one-sided abstractions or provisional anticipations, but rather as presentiments of Don Giovanni, except that there is always something left behind, which more or less justifies my using the expression ‘stage’, in that they are one-sided presentiments, each of them intimating one side only.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The contradiction in the first stage lay in the fact that desire could acquire no object, but was in possession of its object without having desired it, and therefore could not reach the point of desiring.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In the second stage, the object appears in its multiplicity, but since desire seeks its object in this multiplicity, in a deeper sense it still has no object, it is not yet specified as desire.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In Don Giovanni, on the other hand, desire is specified absolutely as desire, is connotationally and extensionally the immediate unity of the two preceding stages.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The first stage desired the One ideally; the second desired the particular under the category of the multiple; the third stage is the unity of these.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: In the particular, desire has its absolute object, it desires the particular absolutely.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Herein lies the seductiveness of which we shall speak later.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Desire in this stage is therefore absolutely sound, victorious, triumphant, irresistible, and demonic.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It must of course not be forgotten, therefore, that it is not a question here of desire in a particular individual but of desire as a principle, spiritually specified as that which spirit excludes.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This is the idea of the spirit of sensuality, as was also intimated above.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The expression of this idea is Don Giovanni, and the expression of Don Giovanni is, again, solely music.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: It is these two considerations in particular which will be constantly highlighted from different angles in what follows, from which also the proof will be indirectly furnished for this opera’s classic significance.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: To make it easier for the reader to keep an overview, however, I shall attempt to collect the scattered considerations under particular headings.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: To present some unitary view of this music is not my intention, and in particular I shall, with the support of all good spirits, take care not to scare together a mass of platitudinous but very noisy predicates, or to betray in linguistic lasciviousness the impotence of language, the more so since I do not regard this impotence as an imperfection in language but as a high potency, yet am therefore also the more willing to recognize music within its own limits.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: What I do want to do, on the other hand, is in part to illuminate the idea from as many angles as possible, and its relation to language, and in this way constantly encompass more and more of the territory in which music has its home, scaring it into breaking cover, as it were, though without my being able to say more about it, once it can be heard, than, ‘Listen!’  [Nor shall I] give a running commentary on the music, for really that can only contain subjective contingencies and idiosyncrasies and can only appeal to something corresponding in the reader.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: What I shall do, however, is constantly ferret out the musical in the idea, the situation, etc., hear it out, and when I have brought the reader to the point of being musically receptive enough to seem to hear the music although hearing nothing, I have completed my task, I make myself mute, I say to the reader as to myself: listen!
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: You friendly genii who protect all innocent love, to you I commit all my faculties, watch over the busy thoughts that they may be found worthy of their object, fashion my soul into a euphonious instrument, let the gentle breezes of eloquence pass swiftly over it, send the refreshment and blessing of fruitful moods!
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: You righteous spirits who stand guard at the boundaries in the realm of beauty, watch over me lest, in muddled enthusiasm and a blind zeal to make Don Giovanni all, I do not do it injustice, demean it, make it something other than it really is, which is the highest!
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: You powerful spirits who know how to stir the heart of man, stand by me that I may capture the reader, not in the net of passion, nor the artifices of eloquence, but in the eternal truth of conviction.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Sensual Genius Specified as Seduction When the Don Juan idea originated is not known;25 all we know is that it belongs to Christianity, and through Christianity it belongs in turn to the Middle Ages.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: If one were unable to trace back the idea in human consciousness to that period of world history with any degree of certainty, a consideration of the inner nature of the idea would immediately dispel any doubt.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The Middle Ages in general embody the idea of representation, partly consciously, partly unconsciously; the total is represented in a single individual, yet in such a way that only one aspect is determined as totality.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The single individual who epitomizes the totality is therefore both more and less than an individual.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Alongside this individual stands another individual who just as totally represents another side of life’s content, as with the knight and the scholastic, the ecclesiastic and the layman.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The grand dialectic of life is thus invariably illustrated by representative individuals, who more often than not confront each other in pairs; life is always presented only in one aspect, and there is no hint of the great dialectical unity which embraces life under both aspects.26 The oppositions therefore usually stand, indifferently, outside each other.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Of all this the Middle Ages knew nothing.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Thus they themselves realized the representative idea unconsciously, while only a later reflection sees in them the idea.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: If the Middle Ages posit for their own consciousness an individual as representative of the idea, then they usually posit at his side another individual in relation to him.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This relationship is then generally a comic one, where the one individual as it were compensates for the disproportionate greatness of the other in actual life.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Thus the king has his fool by his side, Faust has his Wagner, Don Quixote Sancho Panza, and Don Giovanni Leporello.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This arrangement, too, belongs essentially to the Middle Ages.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Thus the idea belongs to the Middle Ages; it is not, in the Middle Ages, the property of a single poet, it is one of those ideas with a primal power that spring from the popular consciousness with primordial aboriginality.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The Middle Ages had to make the discord between flesh and spirit, which Christianity introduced to the world, a subject of their consideration, and to that end they made the contending forces individual objects of intuition.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: So Don Juan is, dare I say, flesh incarnate, or the inspiration of the flesh by the flesh’s own spirit.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: This is already sufficiently emphasized in the foregoing; the question I would call attention to here, however, is whether we ought to refer Don Juan to the earlier or later Middle Ages.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Either he is, then, the dissenting, misunderstood anticipation of the erotic that was manifest in the knight errant, or chivalry is an as yet merely relative contrast to the spirit, and only when the opposition became still sharper did Don Juan appear as the sensual which opposes the spirit at all costs.

chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: If one now supposes the principle of the spirit to be posited in the world, one can either imagine that the most glaring contrast, the most titanic disjunction came first, and later was gradually mitigated, in which case Don Juan belongs to the earlier Middle Ages; or, assuming instead that the relation developed progressively into this absolute opposition, as is also more natural, the spirit taking more and more of its shares out of the joint firm so as to act alone, whereupon the real skandalon27 appears, then Don Juan belongs to the later Middle Ages.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: We are led on then to that point in time where the Middle Ages are about to come to an end, and where we meet a related idea, namely Faust – except that Don Juan must be placed a little earlier.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: As the spirit, exclusively specified as spirit, renounces this world, feels that this is not simply not its home but not even its scene of action, and withdraws up into the higher regions, it leaves the worldly behind as the arena for the power with which it has always lived in conflict and for which it now steps aside.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: As the spirit then frees itself from the world, sensuality appears in all its power; it offers no objection to the change, it too sees the advantage in being separated, and rejoices that the Church does not prevail on them to stay together, but hews asunder the bond that binds them.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: Stronger than ever before, sensuality now awakens in all its richness, in all its rapture and exultation, and just as that recluse in nature, the reticent echo that never speaks first to anyone or speaks without being asked, found such great pleasure in the knight’s hunting horn and his love ballads, in the baying of hounds, the snorting of horses, that it never tired of repeating these over and over again and, in the end, completely under its breath, so as not to forget them, so the whole world became an abode for sensuality’s worldly spirit, echoing from all sides, while the spirit had abandoned the world.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: The Middle Ages have as much to say of a mountain not found on any map; it is called Venusberg.28 There the sensual has its home, there it has its wild pleasures, for it is a kingdom, a state.

sentence: In this kingdom language has no home, nor thought’s sobriety, nor the laborious business of reflection.
chapter_text: The Immediate Erotic Stages or the Musical Erotic

sentence: All one hears there is the elemental voice of passion, the play of the appetites, the wild din of intoxication; indulgence, only, in an eternal tumult.

sentence: The first-born of this kingdom is Don Juan.

sentence: In their inconstancy they may, indeed, bear a certain resemblance to Don Giovanni and, to mention just one example, Hercules could surely produce a fairsized list, considering that he sometimes helped himself to families numbering up to fifty daughters, and like a family son-in-law, according to some reports, had his way with all of them in a single night.

sentence: And it must be a warning against any such partisan attempt to separate them that aestheticians still constantly invoke Aristotle’s apparatus of conditions and criteria as exhaustive of the concept.
