sentence: It is on this that everything hinges.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Only when one can get a person to stand at the crossroads in such a way that he has no expedient but to choose, does he choose what is right.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So if you should happen, before you have a chance to read the whole of this somewhat lengthy inquiry, which again is being sent to you in the form of a letter, if you should happen to feel that the moment of the choice has come, throw away the rest, do not bother with it at all, you have not lost anything – but choose, and you shall see what validity there is in it; yes, no young girl can be as happy in the choice of her heart as a man who has known how to choose.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Either, then, one is to live aesthetically or one is to live ethically.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In this, as I have said, there is no question yet of a choice in a stricter sense; for someone who lives aesthetically does not choose, and someone who, once the ethical has become apparent to him, chooses the aesthetic, does not live in the aesthetic sphere for he sins and comes under the category of the ethical, even if his life must be described as unethical.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: My either/or does not denote in the first instance the choice between good and evil, it denotes the choice whereby one chooses good and evil or excludes them.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The question here is, under what categories one wants to contemplate the entire world and would oneself live.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: That someone who chooses good and evil chooses the good is indeed true, but this becomes evident only afterwards, for the aesthetic is not evil but indifference, and that is why I said that it is the ethical that constitutes choice.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is less a matter, then, of choosing between willing good or evil than of choosing to will but, with this latter, good and evil are posited once again.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Someone who chooses the ethical chooses the good, but the good here is wholly abstract; choosing the ethical merely posits it, and from that it does not follow that the chooser cannot choose evil again, notwithstanding he chose good.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Here, again, you see the importance of choosing, and that what is crucial is not so much deliberation as the baptism of choice by which it is assumed into the ethical.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The more time goes, the more difficult the act of choice becomes, for the soul always finds itself on one side of the dilemma, and it therefore becomes harder and harder to tear oneself away.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: And yet that is necessary if there is to be a choice, and also of supreme importance if a choice is to mean anything, as I shall show below that it does.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Although I am no philosopher, I am obliged at this point to hazard a little philosophical reflection, which I would ask you not so much to criticize as to bear in mind.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For the polemical outcome echoing through all your hymns of victory over life bears a remarkable resemblance to the pet theory of recent philosophy, that the principle of contradiction is annulled.11 I know well enough that the standpoint you adopt is an abomination to philosophy; yet it strikes me that philosophy itself is guilty of the same error; yes, that the reason why this has not been noticed from the start is that philosophy is even less well placed than you are.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Your situation is the domain of action, philosophy’s is that of contemplation.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: As soon as one transfers that to the practical domain it must come to the same result as you, though not expressing itself in the same way.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You mediate oppositions in a higher lunacy, philosophy does so in a higher unity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You turn to the future, for action is essentially future-oriented: you say, ‘I can either do this or do that, but whichever I do is equally wrong, ergo I do nothing at all.’ Philosophy turns to the past, to the whole of world-historical experience, it shows how the separated elements come together in a higher unity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For the philosopher world history is concluded, and he mediates.12 Thus in our age it is part of the order of the day to be confronted with the distasteful sight of young men able to mediate Christianity and paganism, able to play with the titanic forces of history, yet who are unable to tell a plain man what he has to do here in life, and who do not know any better what they themselves have to do.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: As truly as there is a future, just as truly is there an either/or.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The time in which the philosopher lives is not absolute time, it is itself an element in that, and one should always have misgivings when a philosopher bears no fruit; indeed it should be considered a dishonour, just as in the East it is considered a disgrace to be barren.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So time itself is an element, and philosophy itself is an element in time.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Our own age in its turn will appear to a later age as a discursive moment and a philosopher of a later age will again mediate it, and so on.13 To that extent philosophy is within its rights, and it should be considered an accidental error on the part of the philosophy of our own time that it mistook our age for absolute time.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But this clearly means that the category of mediation has suffered a significant blow, and that absolute mediation is only possible when history is finished, in other words that the System is in constant process of becoming.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But recognition that an absolute mediation exists is what philosophy has retained.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This, naturally, is of the utmost importance, since if one abandons mediation one abandons speculation.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: On the other hand, one has scruples about admitting it, for if mediation is admitted there is no absolute choice, and then there is no absolute either/or.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This is the difficulty, yet I believe it to be due partly to a confusion between two spheres, those of thought and freedom.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For thought the opposition has no substance, it goes over into the other and the opposites thus come together in a higher unity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For freedom the opposition does have substance, because the one opposite now excludes the other.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I am not by any means mistaking liberum arbitrium14 for the true positive freedom, for even the latter has for all eternity evil outside itself, if only as an impotent possibility, and its way of perfecting itself is not by increasingly accepting evil but by increasingly excluding it, and exclusion is precisely the opposite of mediation.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Later I shall show that I do not mean by this to assume the notion of a radical evil.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The spheres that are properly the concern of philosophy, those that are properly spheres for thought, are logic, nature and history.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Here necessity rules and so mediation has its validity, That this is true of logic and nature nobody will deny; but with history there are difficulties, for here freedom is said to rule.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: However, I believe that history is viewed incorrectly and that this is the source of the difficulty.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For history is more than a product of the free actions of free individuals.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The individual acts, but this action enters into the order of things which sustains the whole of existence.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: What its outcome will be the agent does not really know.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But this higher order of things, which, so to speak, digests the free actions and kneads them together in its eternal laws, is necessity, and this necessity is the movement in world history; it is therefore quite right for the philosopher to use mediation, that is to say relative mediation.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If I consider a world-historical individual, I can distinguish between the ‘works’ of which the Scripture says that they ‘do follow’ him15 and the works through which he belongs to history.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: With what might be called inward works philosophy has nothing whatever to do; but inward work is the true life of freedom.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Philosophy looks at the outward work and sees it not in isolation but as it is absorbed into and transformed by the world-historical process.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is this process that really forms philosophy’s object and philosophy looks at it under the category of necessity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Therefore it keeps at a distance the reflection which would point out that everything might have been otherwise.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It looks at world history in a way in which there can be no question of an either/or  though it cannot occur to any philosopher to deny there is one for the acting individual.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Hence the lack of concern, the conciliation, with which philosophy regards history and its heroes, for it considers them under the category of necessity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Hence, too, its helplessness at getting a man to act, its tendency to let everything come to a standstill, for what it really demands is that one act from necessity, and that is a contradiction.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Thus even the humblest individual has a dual existence.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Also, he has a history, and this is not just a product of his own free actions.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But the inward work belongs to himself and will belong to him in all eternity; this neither history nor world history can take from him, it follows him either to his joy or to his sorrow.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In this world there rules an absolute either/or, but it is a world philosophy has nothing to do with.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If I imagine an elderly man looking back on an eventful life, he can get a mediation out of it for thought since his history was woven into that of the time.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But deep inside he gets no mediation; an either/or is still constantly separating what was separated when he made his choice.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If one were to talk here of a mediation, one might say it was repentance; but repentance is no mediation, it does not look with longing upon that which should be mediated, that thing is consumed in its wrath; but this is much like exclusion, the opposite of mediation.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Here it is also evident that I do not assume a notion of radical evil when I admit the reality of repentance.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Repentance is indeed an expression of conciliation, but it is also an absolutely unconciliatory expression.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So it is freedom I am fighting for (partly in this letter, partly and foremost in myself), for the future, for either/or.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: That is the treasure I plan to bequeath to those whom I love in the world; yes, if my little son were at this moment of an age that he could understand me and my last hour had come, I would say to him, ‘I leave you no fortune, no title and honours, but I know where a treasure lies buried which can make you richer than the whole world; and this treasure belongs to you, and you are not even to thank me for it, so no injury is done to your soul through owing a man everything; this treasure is deposited in your own inner being: it is an either/or which makes a man greater than the angels.’ Here I will break off this reflection.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Perhaps it does not satisfy you.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Your greedy eye devours it without you getting your fill, but that is because the eye gets its fill last,16 especially when, like you, one is not hungry but merely suffering from an unappeasable craving of the eye.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: What stands out in my either/or is the ethical.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So far, then, it is not a matter of the choice of some thing, not a matter of the reality of the thing chosen, but of the reality of choosing.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is this, though, that is decisive and what I shall try to awaken you to.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: To reach this point it is possible for one man to help another, but once he has reached it the importance the one can have for the other becomes more subordinate.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I have remarked in a previous letter that the experience of having loved gives to a man’s nature a harmony that is never entirely lost; now I want to say that choosing gives to a man’s nature a solemnity, a quiet dignity, that is never entirely lost.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Many people set extraordinarily great store by having seen one or another remarkable world-historical personage face to face.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The impression is one they never forget, it has given to their souls an ideal picture which ennobles their natures.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Yet even that instant, however significant, is nothing compared with the instant of choice.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: When around me all has become still, solemn as a starlit night, when the soul is all alone in the world, there appears before it not a distinguished person, but the eternal power itself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is as though the heavens parted, and the I chooses itself – or, more correctly, it accepts itself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The soul has then seen the highest, which no mortal eye can see and which never can be forgotten.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The personality receives the accolade of knighthood which ennobles it for an eternity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He does not become someone other than he was before, he becomes himself; consciousness unites.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Just as an heir, even if he inherits all the world’s treasures, does not own them before coming of age, even the richest personality is nothing before he has chosen himself, and on the other hand, even what might be called the poorest personality is everything when he has chosen himself; for the great thing is not to be this or that, but to be oneself; and every person can be that if he wants.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: That in a sense it is not a matter of a choice of something, you can see from the fact that what appears on the opposite side is the aesthetic, which is indifference.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Yet it is a matter of a choice, yes, an absolute choice; for only through choosing absolutely can one choose the ethical.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Through the absolute choice, then, the ethical is posited, but from that it by no means follows that the aesthetic is excluded.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In the ethical the personality is centred in itself; the aesthetic is thus excluded absolutely, or it is excluded as the absolute, but relatively it always stays behind.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The personality, through choosing itself, chooses itself ethically and excludes the aesthetic absolutely; but since it is, after all, he himself the person chooses, and through choosing himself does not become another nature but remains himself, the whole of the aesthetic returns in its relativity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So the either/or I have presented is in a sense absolute, for the options are choosing and not choosing.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: When the choice confronting one is thus absolute, either/or is also that.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In another sense, however, the absolute either/or first appears with the choice, for it is now that the options of good and evil appear.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But this choice posited by and in the first choice need not detain me here, I would merely press you to the point where the choice proves necessary and after that consider life under ethical categories.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I am no ethical rigorist inspired by a formal abstract freedom; once the choice is posited the whole of the aesthetic returns, and you shall see that only then is life beautiful, and that only in this way can a person succeed in saving his soul and gaining the whole world, in using the world and not abusing it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But what is it to live aesthetically, and what is it to live ethically?
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: What is the aesthetic factor in a person, and what the ethical?
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: To this I would answer: The aesthetic factor in a person is that by which he is immediately what he is; the ethical factor is that by which he becomes what he becomes.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Someone who lives in and by and of and for the aesthetic factor in himself lives aesthetically.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is not my aim here to enter into a more detailed consideration of all that this definition of the aesthetic implies.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It would also seem superfluous to want to enlighten you on what it is to live aesthetically, you who are a practitioner of such virtuosity in that area that it is rather I who am in need of your help.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Nevertheless, I shall sketch several stages so that we can work our way up to the point where your life really belongs, which is of importance to me if you are not to elude me at too early a stage with one of your favourite digressions.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Besides, I do not doubt that there is much I can indeed enlighten you on in regard to what it is to live aesthetically.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Although I would send anyone wanting to live aesthetically to you as the most reliable guide, I would not refer to you if, in a higher sense, he wanted to gain insight into what it is to live aesthetically; on that you would not be able to enlighten him because you are yourself caught up in it; it could only be explained to him by someone who stands a step higher, or by someone who lives ethically.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You might be tempted for just a second to come up with the quibble that neither could I give a reliable explanation of what it is to live ethically, since I am caught up in that.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This, however, would merely give me the opportunity to offer further enlightenment.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The reason why someone who lives aesthetically cannot, in a higher sense, give any enlightenment is that he lives constantly in the moment, that his knowing is after all confined constantly to a certain relativity, within a certain boundary.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is not at all my purpose to deny that living aesthetically, when such a life is at its peak, can call for a multiplicity of intellectual gifts, even, indeed, that these may be developed to an unusual degree; but they are fettered and transparency is lacking.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Thus one often finds species of animals with senses much keener and of far greater intensity than those of man, but they are bound to the animal’s instinct.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I would gladly take you as an example.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I have never denied your outstanding intellectual gifts, as you will see from the fact that I have often enough reproached you for abusing them.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You are witty, ironic, observant, a dialectician, experienced in pleasure, you can calculate the instant, you are sentimental, heartless, all depending on the circumstances.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But beneath all this you are all the time only in the moment, your life therefore disintegrates and it is impossible for you to explain it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Now if someone wanted to learn the art of pleasure, it would be quite right to go to you; but if he wants to understand your life, he is addressing himself to the wrong person.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: With me he would perhaps sooner find what he seeks, although I by no means possess your intellectual gifts.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You are caught up, and have as it were no time to tear yourself away; I am not caught up, either in my judgement of the aesthetic or in that of the ethical, just because within the ethical I am raised above the instant, I am in freedom; but it is a contradiction to suggest that one can be caught up in being free.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Every man, however modest his talents, however subordinate his position, feels a natural need to form a view of life, a conception of life’s meaning and aim.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: A person who lives aesthetically has that too, and the general description heard in all ages and from the most diverse stages is this: one must enjoy life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It has, of course, very many variations, accordingly as conceptions of pleasure vary, but in this expression, that one must enjoy life, they are all united.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But the person who says that he wants to enjoy life always posits a condition which is either outside the individual or in the individual but not posited by the individual himself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I would beg you, regarding this last point, to keep a fairly good hold of the expressions used, since they are chosen with care.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Let us now review these stages quite briefly in order to catch up with you.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You are perhaps already a little annoyed at my proposal for a general description of living aesthetically; still, you can hardly deny its accuracy.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: One hears you often enough scoffing at people for not knowing how to enjoy life, while you think that you, for your part, have studied it from top to bottom.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is quite possible they do not understand it, but in the expression itself they none the less agree with you.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Perhaps, then, you suspect that, in this inquiry, you are to be teamed up with people who are otherwise an abomination to you.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Maybe you think I should be courteous enough to treat you as an artist and pass over in silence those dabblers you have trouble enough with in life and with whom you wish to have nothing in common.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: However, I cannot help you here, for there is something that you have in common with them after all, and something very essential at that – namely, a view of life; and in my eyes that in which you differ from them is unessential.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I cannot help laughing at you; do you not see, my young friend, that it is a curse that accompanies you, these many brothers in art that you acquire but whom you have no intention at all of acknowledging?
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You are prone to poor and vulgar company, you who are so superior.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I don’t deny it must be very disagreeable to have a life-view in common with every carouser or sportsman.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Nor, indeed, is that altogether the case; for you are placed to some degree beyond the aesthetic domain, as I shall show later.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Great as the differences within the aesthetic sphere may be, all stages have the essential similarity that spirit appears not in the form of spirit but in the form of immediacy.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The differences may be extraordinary, from plain philistinism to the greatest intellectual refinement, but even at the stage where such refinement appears the spirit has the form not of spirit but of talent.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I will describe each particular stage quite briefly and dwell only on what, in one way or another, fits your case, or that I could wish you would apply to yourself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In its immediate guise, personality has the form not of the spiritual but of the psychic.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Here we have a life-view which teaches that health is the most precious good, that on which everything depends.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The same view is given a more poetic expression when beauty is said to be the highest thing.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Beauty, however, is a very fragile good, and it is seldom that one sees this view of life enacted.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: One comes across a young girl, often enough, or a young man, who for a brief period set great store by their beauty, but it soon lets them down.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I remember, however, in my student days,  sometimes on my holidays I went to the residence of a count in one of the provinces.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In his younger days he had had a diplomatic post, but was now elderly and lived quietly on his country estate.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The countess had been exceptionally beautiful as a young girl; even in her old age she was the most beautiful lady I have seen.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Both of them were highly cultivated, yet the countess’s life-view was concentrated on the thought that they were the most beautiful couple in the whole land.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I still recall quite vividly an occurrence which convinced me of this.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It was a Sunday morning and there was a little festival at the nearby church.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The countess did not feel well enough to attend; but the count betook himself there in the morning, dressed up in all his finery, his uniform of gentleman-in-waiting, decorated with his orders.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The windows of the great hall opened upon an avenue which led up to the church.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The countess was standing at one of them.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Far down the avenue the count appeared  and when he came near enough to see the countess through the window, with grace and decorum she threw him a kiss, then turned to me and said ‘Little Vilhelm, isn’t my Ditlev the handsomest man in the whole kingdom?
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Yes, I can see he looks a little sunken on one side, but no one notices it when I’m walking with him, and when we walk together we are surely the handsomest couple in the whole land.’ No little miss of sixteen could be as blissfully happy over her fiancé, the handsome gentleman of the bedchamber, as her ladyship over the already aged lord-in-waiting.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Both life-views agree that one must enjoy life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The condition for doing so lies in the individual, but not in a way that it is posited by the individual.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: We proceed.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: We come across views of life which teach that one must enjoy life but place the condition for doing so outside the individual.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This is the case with every life-view which makes wealth, glory, nobility, etc., life’s task and content.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Here I would also speak of a certain kind of infatuation.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Were I to imagine a young girl head-over-heels in love, whose eye knew no pleasure but to see her beloved, whose soul had no thought but for him, whose heart had no desire but to be his, for whom nothing, nothing at all in heaven or on earth, had meaning except him, then here again we have an aesthetic view of life in which the condition is placed outside the individual itself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You, of course, find it foolish to love in that way; you think it is something that only occurs in novels.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is conceivable, however, and one can at least be sure that in the eyes of many, such a love would be regarded as something exceptional.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I will explain later why I cannot approve of it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: We proceed.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: We meet views of life which teach that one must enjoy life but the condition for doing so lies in the individual, though not posited, however, by the individual.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In this case personality is presented in general under the category of talent, a practical talent, a mercantile talent, a mathematical talent, a poetic talent, an artistic talent, a philosophical talent.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Satisfaction in life, pleasure, is sought in the development of this talent.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Perhaps one does not remain with one’s talent in its state of immediacy, one can educate it in all manner of ways, but the condition for satisfaction in life is the talent itself, a condition not posited by the individual.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Those people in whom one finds this life-view are often among those accustomed to being the constant object of your scorn because of their tireless activity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You think you yourself live aesthetically and will in no way admit it of them.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: That you have a different view of what it is to enjoy life is undeniable, but this is not what is essential; the essential thing is that one wants to enjoy life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Your life is far superior to theirs, but theirs is also far more innocent than yours.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Now just as all these views have in common that they are aesthetic, so too they resemble one another in having a certain unity, a certain coherence, that is, one definite thing on which everything depends.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: What they build their lives on is something inherently simple, and so their lives do not split up as those that are built on what is inherently diverse.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The latter is the case with the life-view I shall now dwell on a little more closely.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It teaches: ‘Enjoy life’, and interprets this as: ‘Live for your desire.’ Desire, however, is inherently diverse; it is thus easy to see that a life built on desire splits into an endless diversity, except where in some particular individual desire has, from childhood, become determinate in the form of some particular desire, which then deserves rather to be called a propensity, a bent, for instance for fishing, or hunting, or keeping horses, etc.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Inasmuch as this view of life splits into a diversity, it is easy to see that it lies in the sphere of reflection; this reflection, however, is nevertheless always a finite reflection and the personality remains in its immediacy.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In desire itself the individual is immediate, and however cultivated or refined the desire, however artful, the individual is nevertheless in it qua immediate, in the enjoyment he is in the moment, and whatever diversity he has in this respect, he is still always immediate because he is in the moment.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Now, living for the satisfaction of one’s desire is to enjoy a very exclusive position in life, and God be praised we seldom see it practised, due to the tribulations of earthly life which give man something else to think about.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If that were not so, I do not doubt but that we would be frequent enough witnesses to this terrible spectacle; at least one often hears people complain that they feel inhibited by the prosaic life, which often only means that they long to let themselves go in all the wild folly that desire can whirl a man into.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For in order to put this view into practice, the individual must be in possession of a diversity of outward conditions, and this good fortune, or rather misfortune, seldom falls to a man’s lot – misfortune because it is certainly not from the merciful gods, but the gods of wrath, that this good fortune comes.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: One seldom sees this life-view enacted on any significant scale.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: On the other hand, one not infrequently sees people who dabble at it a little, and when the conditions cease to exist they think that if only the conditions had been under their own control, then they would certainly have achieved the happiness and joy they craved for in life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In history, however, now and then one meets examples.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: And since I believe it may be useful to see where this life-view leads, precisely when everything favours it, I will present such a figure, choosing for this end that all-powerful man, the emperor Nero, to whom a world did homage, and who always found himself surrounded by an innumerable host of willing emissaries of pleasure.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Once, with your usual recklessness, you said that one could not blame Nero for setting fire to Rome in order to get some idea of the conflagration of Troy, but that one might question whether he really had enough of the artist in him to know how to enjoy it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Now it is one of your imperial pleasures never to shrink from any thought, never to let it appal you.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For that one needs no imperial guard, not gold and silver, not all the world’s treasures; one can do it quite alone and consummate it privately; it is therefore a wiser pleasure, but no less appalling.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Your aim was not to conduct a defence of Nero, and yet there is a kind of defence in your fixing attention not on what he does but on how he does it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Still, I know very well this recklessness of thought is something one often finds in young people, who try it out, as it were, on the world at such moments, and are then easily tempted to extol it themselves, especially when others are listening.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I know very well that you and every person, yes, that Nero himself would shrink from such wild folly, and yet I would never recommend that any person credit himself in the strictest sense with enough strength not to become a Nero.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For when, to describe Nero’s nature, I mention what in my view was its main constituent, it may well strike you as much too mild a word for that, and yet I am certainly no mild judge, even though there is another sense in which I never judge another person.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But believe you me, the word is not too mild, it is the right one, but it can also show how near a person is to such a lapse; indeed it can be said that there comes a moment, for every person who does not pass his whole life like a child, a glimpse, if only in the distance, of such a damnation.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Nero’s nature was melancholy.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Nowadays it has become something big to be melancholy; in a way I can well see why you find this word too mild; I subscribe to an earlier Church doctrine which counted melancholy among the cardinal sins.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If I am right, this to be sure will be very bad news for you, for it turns your whole view of life upside down.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But to avoid misunderstanding, I will remark at once that a person can be in sorrow and distress to such an infinite degree that perhaps it pursues him all his life; and although that may be well and true, a person becomes melancholy only by his own fault.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So I imagine the imperial voluptuary.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I imagine him a little on in years, his youth is past, the lightheartedness has gone out of him, and he is already conversant with every conceivable pleasure, gratified by it to the full.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This life, however dissolute, has nevertheless matured his soul, though in spite of all his worldly understanding, his experience, he is still a child, or a youth.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The immediacy of spirit cannot break through yet demands a breakthrough, a higher form of existence.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But if that is to happen there will come a moment when the splendour of the throne, his power and might, pale, and for this he lacks the courage.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So he grabs at pleasure, all the world’s ingenuity must think up new pleasures for him, for it is only in the moment of pleasure he finds peace, and when it is over he yawns in ennui.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He does not have himself; only when the world shivers for him is he appeased, for then at least there is no one who dares seize him.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Therefore this anxiety for people, something Nero has in common with every such personality.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He burns down half of Rome but his torment is the same.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Soon such things no longer amuse him.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: There is an even higher desire; he wants to make people anxious.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: To himself he is a riddle, and anxiety his being.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Now he wants to be a riddle for everyone and to revel in their anxiety.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: And this anxiety amuses him.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He doesn’t want to impress, he wants to unsettle.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He does not enter proudly, with imperial dignity; weak, impotent, he slinks forward stealthily, for this powerlessness is even more disquieting.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He could have the child hewn down before its mother’s eyes if only her despair might give passion a new expression that could amuse him.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Were he not the Emperor of Rome he might end his life with suicide; for really it is only another expression of the same: that Caligula should want all men’s heads on one neck so the whole could be annihilated with one stroke, and for a man to take his own life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Whether this was the case with Nero I do not know, but in personalities of this kind one sometimes finds a certain good-naturedness, and if Nero had that, I have no doubt that his circle were ready to call it condescension.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This gives the matter a peculiar twist, but it also provides new proof of the immediacy which through its repression constitutes genuine melancholy.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: What, then, is melancholy?
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is hysteria of the spirit.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: There comes a moment in a man’s life when immediacy is as though ripened and when the spirit demands a higher form in which it will apprehend itself as spirit.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In its immediacy spirit coheres, as it were, with the whole of earthly life, and now the spirit wants to gather itself out of this dispersion, and make itself self-transparent; the personality wants to be conscious of itself in its eternal validity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If this does not happen and the movement halts and is pressed back, melancholy sets in.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: One can do much to bring it into oblivion, one can work, one can seize more innocent expedients than a Nero, but the melancholy remains.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: There is something unaccountable in melancholy.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: A person in sorrow or distress knows why he sorrows or is distressed.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If you ask a melancholic what reason he has for his condition, what it is that weighs down on him, he will reply, ‘I don’t know what it is, I can’t explain it.’ Therein lies melancholy’s infinitude.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The reply is perfectly correct, for as soon as he knows what it is, the effect is removed, whereas the grief of the griever is by no means removed by his knowing why he grieves.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But melancholy is sin, really it is a sin as great as any, for it is the sin of not willing deeply and sincerely, and this is a mother to all sins.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This sickness, or more properly, this sin, is extremely common in our time, and accordingly it is under this that the whole of German and French youth groan.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I will not provoke you, I would treat you as considerately as possible.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I gladly admit that being melancholy is in a sense not a bad sign, for as a rule only the most gifted natures are afflicted by it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: People whose souls have no acquaintance with melancholy are those whose souls have no presentiment of metamorphosis.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: These I do not concern myself with here, for I am writing only of and to you, and to you I think this explanation will be satisfactory, for you scarcely assume, as many physicians do, that melancholy is a bodily ailment, though for all that, remarkably enough, physicians cannot cure it; only the spirit can cure it, for it lies in the spirit, and when the spirit finds itself all small sorrows vanish, those reasons which in the view of some produce melancholy – that one cannot find oneself in the world, that one comes to the world both too late and too early, that one cannot find one’s place in life; but for the person who owns himself eternally, it is neither too early nor too late that he comes to the world, and the person who possesses himself in his eternal validity will surely find his significance in this life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This, however, has been a digression, for which I hope you will forgive me, since really it arose for your sake.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I now return to the life-view which thinks one must live to satisfy desire.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: A prudent common sense readily perceives that this cannot be carried through and that it is therefore not worth starting on.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: A refined egoism perceives that it misses the point in pleasure.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Here, then, we have a life-view which teaches ‘Enjoy life’, and then expresses itself again thus: ‘Enjoy yourself; it is you yourself in the enjoyment that you must enjoy.’ This is a higher reflection.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Naturally, however, it does not penetrate into the personality itself; this remains in its accidental immediacy.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: After all, here too the condition for enjoyment is external and not within the individual’s control; for although he, as he says, enjoys himself, he still only enjoys himself in the enjoyment, but the enjoyment itself is tied to an external condition.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The only difference is that his enjoyment is reflective, not immediate.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So even this Epicureanism depends on a condition over which it has no control.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: A certain callousness of reason then teaches a way out: ‘Enjoy yourself in constantly discarding the conditions.’ But self-evidently, the person who enjoys himself in discarding the conditions is just as much dependent on them as the one who enjoys them.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: His reflection turns constantly back on himself, and since his enjoyment consists in the enjoyment’s being given as little content as possible, he is, as it were, hollowing himself out, since naturally such a reflection is incapable of opening the personality.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I believe these observations of mine have now given you at least a recognizable outline of the territory of the aesthetic view of life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: All stages have in common that one lives for that in which one is immediately what one is; for reflection never grasps high enough to reach beyond that.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I have provided no more than a very hasty glimpse, but I have not wished to give more; for me the different stages are not important, only that movement which is unavoidably necessary, as I shall now show, and it is on this I would beg you fasten your attention.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Let me assume, then, that our man who lived for his health was, to use your expression, as quick as ever when he died; that our noble couple danced at their golden wedding and a whisper ran through the hall, just as when they danced on their wedding day; I assume that the rich man’s gold mines were inexhaustible, that honours and esteem marked the happy man’s pilgrimage through life; I assume that the young girl got the one she loved, that with his connections the mercantile talent hitched all five continents together, and kept all the world’s exchanges in his own exchange, that the mechanical talent joined together heaven and earth – I assume that Nero never yawned but a new pleasure surprised him every moment, that every instant our astute Epicurean could enjoy himself by himself, that the Cynic always had conditions [of enjoyment] to discard so as to take pleasure in his own lightness – I assume this, and so all these people were happy.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You would probably not say that; the reason why I shall explain later.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But this you will readily admit: that many people would in fact think this way, yes, that this or that person would fancy he had said something extremely clever if he added that what they lacked was that they did not appreciate the fact.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I will now assume the opposite.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: None of this happens.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So what?
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: They despair.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: No doubt you would not do that either.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Perhaps you will say it isn’t worth the trouble.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Why you will not admit despair I shall explain later; here I ask only that you recognize that a fair number of people find it right and proper to despair.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Let us now see why they despaired.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Because they discovered that what they had built their lives on was transitory?
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But is that, then, a reason to despair, has what they built their lives on changed in any essential?
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Is it an essential change in what is transitory that it prove to be so?
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Or is it not rather the case that if it does not prove to be so, then that is what is accidental and unessential?
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So nothing new has come about that could provide the basis for such a change.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If they do despair, then, that must be because they were in despair beforehand.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The difference is just that they did not know it, but that indeed is an altogether accidental difference.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It turns out, then, that every aesthetic view of life is despair, and that everyone who lives aesthetically is in despair whether he knows it or not.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But if one does know it, and you indeed do, then a higher form of existence is an inescapable requirement.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It might seem, then, that the correct thing was to undertake the movement by which the ethical emerges.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But there is still one stage, however, an aesthetic life-view, the most refined and exclusive of them all, which I shall discuss with the greatest of care, for now it is your turn.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Everything I have explained in the above you can calmly go along with, and in a way it is not you I have been addressing; also it would be of little use talking to you thus or informing you of the vanity of life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: That is something you know very well and have indeed tried in your own way to adjust to.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The reason I have presented it is this: that I want to cover my rear, I want to prevent you from suddenly leaping back.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This last life-view is despair itself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is an aesthetic life-view, for the personality remains in its immediacy; it is the last aesthetic life-view, for it has to an extent admitted to itself a consciousness of the nothingness of such a life-view.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: However, there is despair and despair.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Were I to imagine an artist, a painter, for example, who becomes blind, then if there was any depth in him he might perhaps despair.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: What he despairs over, then, is this particular thing, and if his sight returned the despair would cease.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This is not the case with you.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You are far too gifted mentally, and your soul is in a sense too deep for this to happen to you.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Nor, in outward respects, has any such misfortune befallen you.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You still have in your power all the requirements of an aesthetic life-view.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You have wealth, independence, your health is unimpaired, your mind is still vigorous, and you have not yet been made unhappy by a young girl not wanting to love you.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Yours is no current despair but a despair in thought.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Your thought has hurried on ahead, you have seen through the vanity of everything but you have not come any further.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: On occasion you duck down into it and in abandoning yourself for a single moment to pleasure you discover also, in your consciousness, that it is vanity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You are thus constantly beyond yourself, that is to say, in despair.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This is why your life lies between two huge antitheses: sometimes you are intemperately energetic, at others just as immoderately indolent.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Here, then, I have your life-view, and believe me, much in your life will be explicable to you if, with me, you regard it as thought-despair.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You are a hater of activity in life; quite right, for before there can be any meaning in activity life must have continuity, and this your life lacks.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You occupy yourself with your studies, that is true, you are even industrious.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But it is only for your own sake and is done with as little teleology as possible.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Otherwise you are unoccupied; like those workers in the Gospel, you stand idle in the market-place.17 You stick your hands in your pockets and observe life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Then you rest in despair, nothing occupies you, you don’t step aside for anything: ‘If someone were to throw a tile down from the roof I wouldn’t get out of the way.’ You are like someone dying, you die daily, not in the profound, serious sense in which one usually takes that word, but life has lost its reality and ‘you always reckon your lifetime from one day’s notice to quit to the next’.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You let everything pass you by, it makes no impression, but then suddenly something comes which grips you, an idea, a situation, a smile from a young girl, and then you are ‘in touch’; for just as on some occasions you are not in touch, so at others you are in touch and of service in every way.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Wherever something is going on you are ‘in touch’.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You conduct your life as it is your custom to behave in a crowd, you ‘work your way into the thickest of it, trying if possible to be forced up above the others so as to be able to lie on top of them’; if you manage to get up there you ‘make yourself as comfortable as possible’, and this is also the way you let yourself be carried along through life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But when the crowd disperses, when the event is over, you stand once more at the street corner and look at the world.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: A dying person possesses, as you know, a supernatural energy, and so too with you.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If there is an idea to be thought through, a work to be read through, a plan to be carried out, a little adventure to be experienced – yes, a hat to be bought, you take hold of the matter with an immense energy.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: According to circumstance, you work untiringly for a day, for a month; you are happy in the assurance that you still have the same abundance of strength as before, you take no rest, ‘no Satan can keep up with you’.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If you work together with others, you work them into the ground.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But then when the month or, what you always consider the maximum, the six months have gone, you break off and say, ‘and that’s the end of the story’.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You retire and leave it all to the other party, or if you have been working alone you talk to no one about what you were doing.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You then pretend to yourself and others that you have lost the desire and flatter yourself with the vain thought that you could have kept working with the same intensity if that is what you desired.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But that is an immense deception.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You would have succeeded in finishing it, as most others, if you had patiently willed it so, but you would have found out at the same time that it needs a kind of perseverance quite different from yours.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You are always hovering above yourself, but the higher ether, the more refined sublimate into which you are vaporized, is the nothing of despair and you see below you a multitude of areas of learning, insight, study, observation which for you, though, have no reality but which you quite randomly exploit and combine so as to adorn as tastefully as possible the palace of mental profusion in which you occasionally reside.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: [What] you see below you is a multitude of moods and situations which you use to make interesting contacts with life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You can be sentimental, heartless, ironic, witty; in this respect one must admit you have learning.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Thus as soon as something can rouse you out of your indolence you are fully active, with all your passion, and your activity does not lack art, as you are only too well equipped with wit, resilience, and all the seductive gifts of the mind.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You are, as you yourself with such complacent presumption put it, never so discourteous as to put in an appearance without bringing with you a small, fragrant, freshly plucked bouquet of wit.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The more one knows you, the more one must be astonished at the calculating shrewdness that permeates everything you do in the short time you are moved by passion; for passion never blinds you but only makes you more clear-sighted.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You forget your despair and everything else that weighs upon your soul and thought; the accidental contact you have made with a person absorbs you completely.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: [You] exist in the instant, and in the instant you are of supernatural size; you invest your whole soul in it, even by an effort of will, since in the instant your being is absolutely in your power.
