sentence: Similarly, one often sees people afraid that if ever they fall in love they will not get a girl who is exactly the ideal that suits them.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Who would deny the satisfaction in getting such a girl?
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: On the other hand, it is after all a superstition that what lies outside a person is what can make him happy.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The person who lives ethically also wants to be happy in his choice; however, should the choice prove not quite in accord with his wishes, he does not lose courage, he at once sees his task and knows that the art is not to wish but to will.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Many who do, after all, have some conception of what a human life is, wish to be contemporary with great events, to be involved in important situations in life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Who would deny that such things have their validity?
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is a superstition, on the other hand, to think that events and situations as such make a man into something.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: A person who lives ethically knows that in any situation it is a question of what one sees and with what energy one regards it, and that the person cultivating himself in this way in the least significant situations in life may experience more than the person who has been a witness to, indeed a participant in, the most notable events.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He knows that everywhere there is a dance floor, that even the lowliest man has his own, that when he himself so wishes, his dance can be just as beautiful, just as graceful, just as expressive, just as moving as that of those who have been assigned a place in history.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is this fencing skill, this suppleness, which is properly the immortal life of the ethical.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: To the person who lives aesthetically the old saying, ‘to be or not to be’, applies and the more aesthetically he is allowed to live, the more demands his life exacts, and if only the least of them is not fulfilled he is dead; the person who lives ethically always has a way out even when everything goes against him, even when the storm-filled clouds brood over him so darkly that his neighbour cannot see him, he has not perished, there is always a point he keeps hold of, and it is – himself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Just one thing I would insist upon: that as soon as the ethicist’s gymnastics become an experimentation he has ceased to live ethically.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: All such gymnastic experimenting is nothing but what counts, in the realm of knowledge, as sophistry.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I want now to recall the definition of the ethical I gave earlier, that it is that whereby a man comes to be what he becomes.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So it wants not to make the individual into another but into himself; it wants not to do away with the aesthetic but to transfigure it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: To live ethically it is necessary for a person to become aware of himself, so totally that no accidental feature escapes him.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The ethical does not want to erase this concretion but sees in it its task, sees from what it must build and what is to be built.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: People generally consider the ethical altogether abstractly and therefore they have a secret horror of it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The ethical is then looked upon as something alien to personal being, and one shrinks from abandoning oneself to it, for one cannot quite be sure what it may lead to in the course of time.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Many are also afraid of death in the same way, because they entertain obscure and confused ideas about the soul passing over in death into another order of things, where laws and customs prevail which are altogether different from those they have learnt to recognize in this world.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The reason for such a fear of death is the individual’s reluctance to be transparent to himself, for provided one is willing it is easy to see the absurdity of this fear.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Similarly with the ethical; a person who fears transparency will always shun the ethical, for really the ethical wants nothing else.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Opposed to an aesthetic view of life which would enjoy life, one often hears talk of another life-view in which the meaning of life is to live for the fulfilment of life’s duties.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This is meant to be an ethical life-view.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: However, that is a very imperfect expression of it, and one might almost believe it was invented to discredit the ethical.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: At all events, nowadays one often sees it used in a way that almost causes a smile.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The mistake is this, that the individual is placed in an external relation to duty.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The ethical is defined as duty, and duty again as a mass of particular propositions, but the individual and duty stand outside each other.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: A life of duty in this sense is naturally very unattractive and tedious, and if the ethical did not have some much deeper connection with personal being, it would always be very difficult to defend it against the aesthetic.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: That there are many people who come no further than this I will not deny; but that has to do with the people, not with duty.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is rather strange that the word ‘duty’ [Pligt] can bring to mind an external relation when the derivation of the word indicates it is an internal relation.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For surely what it is incumbent upon me to do, not as this contingent individual but in respect of my true nature, stands in the most intimate relation to me.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For duty is not an imposition [Paalœg] but something which imposes [paaligger].
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Seeing duty in this way is a sign that the individual has found his bearings within himself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Duty will then not be split up into a multiplicity of particular directives, for that always implies that the individual stands only in an external relation to it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He has invested himself in the duty, for him it is the expression of his inmost nature.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: When he has thus found his bearings within himself, he is steeped in the ethical and will have no need to urge himself breathlessly on into fulfilling his duties.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The truly ethical individual has, therefore, an inner calm and assurance because he does not have duty outside him but inside him.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The more deeply a person imparts an ethical structure to his life, the less he will feel the need to talk every instant of duty, to be anxious every instant that he is fulfilling it, to confer every instant with others about what his duty is.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Viewed rightly the ethical makes the individual infinitely secure within himself; when it is not viewed rightly it makes the individual completely insecure, and I can imagine no unhappier and more agonizing life than that of someone who has got his duty outside him and yet is constantly wanting to realize it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If the ethical appears to lie outside one’s personal being and to be in external relation to it, one has given everything up; one has despaired.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The aesthetic as such is despair, the ethical is the abstract and as such incapable of bringing about the slightest thing.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So when occasionally one sees people with a certain honest zeal struggling and straining to realize the ethical, which like a shadow keeps running away as they try to take hold of it, it is both comic and tragic.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The ethical is the universal and as such the abstract.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In its complete abstraction the ethical is therefore always interdictory.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The ethical thus presents itself as law.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: As soon as the ethical specifies directives it already contains something of the aesthetic.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The Jews were the people of the Law.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So they had an excellent understanding of most of the commandments in the Laws of Moses; but the commandment they seem not to have understood was the one with which Christianity most closely associated itself: ‘Thou shalt love God with all thine heart.’ Nor is this a negative commandment, and it is not abstract, it is positive in the highest degree and concrete in the highest degree.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: When the ethical becomes more concrete it passes over into the specification of moral behaviour.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But the reality of the ethical in this respect lies in the reality of a popular identity, and here the ethical has already assumed an aesthetic element.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Nevertheless the ethical is still abstract and cannot be fully realized because it lies outside the individual.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Only when the individual himself is the universal, only then can the ethical be realized.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This is the secret of conscience, it is the secret the individual life shares with itself, that it is at one and the same time an individual life and also the universal, if not as such in its immediacy, at least according to its possibility.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The person who regards life ethically sees the universal, and the person who lives ethically expresses his life in the universal; he makes himself into the universal man, not by divesting himself of his concretion, for then he would be nothing at all, but by clothing himself in it and permeating it with the universal.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For the universal man is not a phantom, everyone is the universal man – that is to say, everyone is shown the path along which he becomes the universal man.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Someone who lives aesthetically is the accidental man, he thinks he is the perfect man through being the only man.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The person who lives ethically works at becoming the universal man.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Thus the accidental plays an enormous part for a man who is aesthetically in love, and it is of importance to him that no one has loved with just the nuances that he has.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If the person who lives ethically marries, he realizes the universal.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Therefore he does not become a hater of the concrete but has one more expression, deeper than any aesthetic expression, inasmuch as he sees in the love a revelation of the universal human.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So the person who lives ethically has himself as his task.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: His self in its immediacy is accidentally specified and the task is to work the accidental and the universal together.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So the ethical individual does not have duty outside him but inside him; this first appears in the moment of despair and then works its way forward through the aesthetic, in and with the latter.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: One can say of the ethical individual that he is like those still waters that run deep, whereas the person living aesthetically is simply agitated on the surface.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So once the ethical individual has completed his task, has fought the good fight,32 he has reached the point of having become the only man – that is, there is no man just like him – and at the same time of having become the universal man.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Being the only man is in itself nothing so great, for that is something all men share with every natural phenomenon.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But being it in such a way that at the same time he is the universal, that is the true art of living.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So one’s personal being does not have the ethical outside it but inside it, and it breaks forth from this deep.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: What matters then is, as I said, that it does not do away with the concrete in an abstract and empty storming, but assimilates it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Because the ethical lies deepest in the soul it is not always visible, and someone living ethically can behave exactly like someone living aesthetically so that one can be deluded for a long time; but eventually there comes a moment when it becomes apparent that the person who lives ethically has a boundary not recognized by the other.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In this assurance that his life is structured ethically the individual rests securely confident and so does not pester himself or others with captious fears about this or that.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For I find it just as it should be that someone living ethically retains a blank space for what is ethically indifferent, and it is precisely a veneration of the ethical not to press it upon every insignificant detail.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The attempt to do so, which always fails, is also only to be found among those who do not have courage to believe in the ethical and who lack inner confidence in a deeper sense.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: There are those whose faint-heartedness is discernible precisely in their inability ever to be finished with the totality just because for them this is a manifold, but these, too, lie outside the ethical, for no other reason of course than weakness of will, which like every other spiritual weakness can be regarded as a form of insanity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The lives of such people are spent in straining at a gnat.33 They have no conception either of the pure and beautiful earnest of the ethical or of the unconcerned joy of the indifferent.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But of course, for the ethical individual the indifferent is dethroned and he can set its boundary at any moment.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Thus one believes also in a providence, and the soul rests securely in this assurance, yet one would never think of applying this thought to every accidental happening, nor is one conscious of this belief every minute.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Willing the ethical without being disturbed by the indifferent, believing in providence without being disturbed by the accidental, is a healthy condition which can be acquired and preserved if a man himself so wills it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Here, too, the thing is to see the task, to see that when someone tends to be distracted, that task is to summon up resistance, to keep hold of the infinite and not go on a wild goose chase.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Anyone who chooses himself ethically has himself as a task, not as a possibility, not as a plaything for his caprice to sport with.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He can only choose himself ethically when he chooses himself in continuity, and so he has himself as a multiply specified task.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He does not try to erase the multiplicity or to disperse it; on the contrary, he repents himself firmly into it because this multiplicity is himself, and only by repentantly steeping himself in it can he come to himself, since he does not assume that the world begins with him or that he creates himself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Language has itself branded that idea with contempt and it is always contemptuously that one says of a man: ‘he gives himself airs’ [han skaber sig: lit.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: ‘creates himself’].
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But when he chooses himself repentantly he is active, not in the direction of isolation but of continuity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Now let us compare an ethical and an aesthetic individual.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The main difference, on which everything turns, is that the ethical individual is transparent to himself and does not live ‘out in the blue’ as does the aesthetic individual.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: From this difference everything else follows.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The person who lives ethically has seen himself, knows himself, permeates his whole concretion with his consciousness, does not allow vague thoughts to fuss around in him, nor tempting possibilities to distract him with their legerdemain; he himself is not like a witch’s letter which, depending on how you turn the pages, gives you first this image, then that.34 He knows himself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The expression gnothi seauton is repeated often enough and one has seen in it the aim of all human striving.35 Quite right, too, but it is equally certain that it cannot be the goal unless at the same time it is the beginning.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The ethical individual knows himself, but this knowledge is not mere contemplation, for then the individual would be specified in respect of his necessity; it is a reflection on himself, which is itself an action, and that is why I have been careful to use the expression ‘to choose oneself’ instead of ‘to know oneself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In knowing himself the individual is not complete; on the contrary, this knowledge is highly productive and from it there emerges the true individual.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Were I to be clever I could say here that the individual knew himself in the same way that, in the Old Testament, it is said that Adam knew Eve.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Through the individual’s intercourse with himself the individual gets himself with child and gives himself birth.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The self that the individual knows is at the same time the actual self and the ideal self, which the individual has outside him as an image in whose likeness he has to form himself, yet which he has, on the other hand, within him since he is that self.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Only within himself does the individual have the goal he must strive for, though in striving for it he has that goal outside himself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For if the individual believes the universal man is situated outside him and will come to meet him from outside, then he is disoriented, he has an abstract conception, and his method will always be an abstract annihilation of the original self.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Only from within himself can the individual obtain information about himself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Therefore the ethical life has this twofold nature, that the individual has himself outside himself within himself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: However, the typical self is the imperfect self, for it is only a prophecy and therefore not the actual self.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: However, it constantly attends him; but the more he realizes it the more it disappears into him, until finally, instead of appearing in front of him, it lies behind him as a faded possibility.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This image behaves like a man’s shadow.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In the morning he casts a shadow in front of him, at noon it goes beside him almost unnoticed, and in the evening it falls behind him.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: When the individual knows himself and has chosen himself, he is on the way to realizing himself, but since he must realize himself freely he must know what it is he would realize.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Certainly what he would realize is himself, but that is his ideal self which he can acquire only from within himself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If one does not insist that it is within himself that the individual has the ideal self, one’s thoughts and aspirations will be abstract.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The person who copies another and the person who would copy the normal man both become, though in different ways, equally affected.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The aesthetic individual looks at himself in his concretion and then distinguishes one thing from another.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He sees one thing as belonging to him accidentally, another as belonging essentially.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This distinction is, however, extremely relative, for so long as a person lives merely aesthetically everything belongs to him equally accidentally, and if an aesthetic individual insists on the distinction it is only for lack of energy.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The ethical individual has learnt this in despair, so he has another distinction because he too distinguishes between the essential and the accidental.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Everything posited with his freedom belongs to him essentially, however accidental it may seem; everything else he sees as accidental, however essential it may seem.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: However, for the ethical individual this distinction is not the product of whim, making it look as though he had absolute power to make himself into whatever he wanted.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For although the ethical individual might refer to himself as his own editor, he is at the same time fully aware of his editorial responsibility to himself, in so far as what he chooses has a decisive influence on him personally, to the scheme of things in which he lives, and to God.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Looked at in this way I think the distinction is correct, for after all what belongs to me essentially is only whatever I undertake ethically as a task.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If I refuse to undertake it, that refusing of mine belongs to me essentially.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: When a person looks at himself aesthetically he might make the distinction as follows.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He says, ‘I have a talent for painting, I consider that an accident; but I have wit and acuity, I consider that the essential thing that cannot be taken away from me without my becoming someone else.’ To that I would reply, ‘This whole distinction is an illusion, for if you do not take this wit and acuity upon yourself ethically, as a task, as something you are responsible for, it does not belong to you essentially, and that is mainly because, so long as you only live aesthetically, your whole life is totally unessential.’ The person living ethically abolishes to some extent the distinction between the accidental and the essential, for he takes over every inch of himself as equally essential; but it comes back again since, after he has done that, he makes a distinction, but in such a way that what he excludes as accidental he takes an essential responsibility for in respect of his having excluded it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In so far as the aesthetic individual sets a task for his life with an ‘aesthetic seriousness’, really this is absorbing himself further in his own contingency, becoming an individual the like of whose paradoxical and irregular conduct one has never seen, a grimace of a man.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The reason why one rarely comes across such figures is that one rarely comes across people with a conception of what it is to live.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: On the other hand, since many have a decided partiality for talking, one does come across – in the street, at parties, and in books – a great deal of chatter that bears unmistakably the stamp of the craze for originality which, when put into practice, would enrich the world with a mass of artefacts each more ludicrous than the next.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The task the ethical individual sets himself is to transform himself into the universal individual.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Only the ethical individual renders to himself a serious account of himself and therefore is honest with himself, only he has this paradigmatic dignity and this decorum which are more beautiful than all else.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But to transform oneself into the universal man is only possible if I already have this within me kata dunamin.36 For the universal can very well subsist with and in the singular without consuming the latter; it is like the fire that burned in the bush without consuming it.37 If the universal man is situated outside me only one method is possible, and that is to divest myself of all my concretion.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: One often finds this straining for unbridled abstraction.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: There was a sect among the Hussites who thought that being the normal man really meant going about naked like Adam and Eve in paradise.38 In our own time one not infrequently encounters people offering the same teaching in spiritual respects, that one becomes the normal man by becoming stark naked, which one can do by divesting oneself of all one’s concretion.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But that is not how things are.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The universal man emerged in the act of despair and is then behind the concretion and breaks out through it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: A language has many more paradigm verbs than the ones used as examples in grammars.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is a matter of accident that any particular one is offered; any other regular verb would have done as well.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So too with men.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Everyone can, if he wants, become a paradigm man, not by wiping out his contingency but by remaining in it and ennobling it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But he ennobles it by choosing it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You will now have perceived that in the course of his life the ethical individual goes through the stages we have previously shown to be distinct.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In the course of his life he will develop the personal, the civic, the religious virtues, and his life proceeds through his constantly translating himself from one stage to the next.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Whenever a person thinks that one of these stages is sufficient and is prepared to gather himself one-sidedly in that, he has not chosen himself ethically but has overlooked the importance either of isolation or of continuity, and above all has not grasped that the truth lies in the identity of these.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The person who has chosen and found himself ethically has himself as specified in all his concretion.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He has himself, then, as an individual who has these abilities, these passions, these inclinations, these habits subject to these external influences, and who is influenced thus in one direction and thus in another.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He has himself, then, as a task in a way in which the task in essentials is that of ordering, tempering, kindling, repressing – in short bringing about a proportionality in the soul, a harmony that is the fruit of the personal virtues.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The aim of his activity here is himself, though not arbitrarily specified, for he has himself as a task which is set for him even though it has become his through his having chosen it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But although he himself is his aim, this aim is nevertheless at the same time something else, for the self that is the aim is not an abstract self which fits in everywhere, and so nowhere, but a concrete self which stands in living interaction with these determinate surroundings, these conditions of life, this order of things.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The self which is the aim is not just a personal self, but a social, a civic self.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So he has himself as a task for an activity through which, as this determinate personal being, he intervenes in the affairs of life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Here his task is not to mould himself, but to exert an influence, and yet he does at the same time mould himself, for, as I remarked above, the way in which the ethical individual lives is by constantly translating himself from one stage to another.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Unless the individual has originally apprehended himself as a concrete personality in continuity, he will not acquire this later continuity either.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If he thinks the knack is to begin as a Robinson Crusoe, he will remain an adventurer all his life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But if, on the other hand, he sees that unless he begins concretely he will never get round to beginning, and that if he doesn’t begin he will never end, he will be in continuity simultaneously with the past and the future.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: From the personal life he translates himself into the civic, from the latter into the personal.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The personal life as such was an isolation and therefore incomplete, but by his coming back to his personal being through the civic life the personal life is manifested in a higher form.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Personal being proves to be the absolute that has its teleology in itself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Those who take the task of human life to be the fulfilment of duty have often been reminded of the sceptical view that duty itself vacillates, that the laws can be changed.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You see readily that with the latter one is thinking mainly of the fluctuations to which the civic virtues are always liable.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Still, this scepticism does not apply to negative morals, for they remain unchanged.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: On the other hand there is another sceptical consideration that applies to every duty, namely that I am quite unable in principle to do my duty.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Duty is the universal, what is required of me is the universal, but all I can do is the particular.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The great significance of this sceptical argument, however, is that it proves that one’s personal being is itself the absolute.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But this must be specified in rather more detail.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is interesting that this consideration is highlighted in language itself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I never say to someone that he does duty or duties; I say that he does his duty, I say that I do my duty, that you are to do yours.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This shows that the individual is at once the universal and the particular.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Duty is the universal, it is required of me; consequently if I am not the universal I cannot do it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: On the other hand, my duty is the particular, something for myself alone, and yet it is duty and hence the universal.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This is where personal being is manifested in its highest validity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is not lawless, nor does it give itself its laws, for the category of duty remains, but personal being proves to be the unity of the universal and the particular.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: That this is the situation is clear, it can be made intelligible to a child, for I can perform duties without doing my duty, and I can do my duty without performing duties.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I am quite unable to see why the world should sink into scepticism on that account, for the difference between good and evil always remains, responsibility and duty likewise; even though it is impossible for another man to say what my duty is, it will always be possible for him to say what his duty is, and that would not be the case unless the unity of the universal and the particular were posited.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It might perhaps be thought that all scepticism has been removed by making duty into something external, fixed and definite, of which it can be said: ‘This is duty.’ However, this is a misunderstanding, for it is in the external that the doubt lies, not in the internal, not in my relation to the universal.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: As a particular individual I am not the universal, and it would be absurd to require it of me.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So if I am to be able to perform the universal, I must be the universal at the same time as I am the particular, but in that case the dialectic of duty is within me.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: As I have said, this view implies no danger for the ethical; on the contrary, it emphasizes it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If this is not assumed, the personality will be abstract, its relation to duty abstract, its immortality abstract.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Nor does it abolish the difference between good and evil, for I doubt if there has ever been anyone who maintained it is a duty to do evil.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: That he did evil is another matter, but he tried at the same time to convince himself and others that it was the good.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is inconceivable that he should be able to retain this conviction, since he is himself the universal and so does not have the enemy outside him but inside him.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If, on the other hand, I suppose duty to be something external, then the difference between good and evil is indeed abolished, for if I am not myself the universal I can only come into an abstract relationship to it and the difference between good and evil is incommensurate with an abstract relation.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Precisely when one’s personal being is perceived to be absolute, to be its own aim, the unity of the universal and the particular, precisely then will every scepticism which takes the historical as its point of departure be overcome.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Freethinkers have often tried to introduce conceptual confusion by drawing attention to how people have sometimes held sacred and legal what in the eyes of others was repellent and criminal.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Here one has allowed oneself to be dazzled by the external, while in the case of the ethical it is never a question of the external but of the internal.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: However much the external may change, the ethical content of the action can still be the same.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Thus it is certain there have never been people who thought that children should hate their parents.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: However, to foster doubt, attention has been directed at the fact that, while all cultivated nations have made it a duty for children to care for their parents, it has been the custom among primitives to put their aged parents to death.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Perhaps so, but it takes us no further, for the question remains whether in doing this the primitives actually thought they were doing something evil.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Ethical consideration lies always in this consciousness, while whether one is accountable for lack of knowledge is another question.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The freethinker sees very well that the easiest way to volatilize the ethical is to open the door to historical infinity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: And yet there is some truth in his procedure, for if in the final analysis the individual is not the absolute, empirical reality is the only road open to him, and as for where it issues that road has the same property as the river Niger in respect of its source: no one knows its location.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If I am shown the road to the finite, it is gratuitous to remain stationary at any particular point.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: On that road, then, one never arrives at the point of beginning, for in order to begin one would have to have reached the end and that is impossible.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: When personal being is the absolute it is itself the Archimedean point from which one can lift the world.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is easy to see that being conscious of this cannot lead the individual into wanting to cast off reality, for if that was how he wanted to be the absolute he would be nothing at all, an abstraction.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is only as the particular that he is the absolute, and his awareness of that will save him from all revolutionary radicalism.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Here I will break off my theorizing; I feel keenly that I am not fit for the part, nor wish that I were, but will be quite content if I may be thought an acceptable practitioner.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Besides, all theorizing takes so much time.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: What I can accomplish in an instant as an active agent, or set about straightaway, calls for much fuss and ado before it can be put into words and described.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Now I have no mind to expound a doctrine of duty to you and to talk in the customary way of duties to God, oneself and one’s neighbour.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Not that I by any means repudiate this classification, nor would I have it that what I have to say is too profound to be linked with Balle’s textbook,39 or presupposes more background knowledge than that textbook presupposes; not at all for that reason, but because I believe that what matters with the ethical is not the multiplicity of duty but its intensity.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: When one has felt in one’s personal being the full strength of duty’s intensity, one is ethically mature and duty will then break out in one.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The main thing, then, is not whether someone can count on his fingers how many duties he has, but that he has had that once-and-for-all experience of the intensity of duty so that his consciousness of it is his assurance of the eternal validity of his being.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So I do not at all applaud a strong sense of duty, any more than I would recommend being a bookworm, and yet it is certain that someone to whom the importance of duty has never, in all its infinity, come to light is just as mediocre as the scientist who thinks, after the manner of the people of Mol,40 that one hits upon wisdom mir nichts und dir nichts.41 Let the casuists be engrossed in hitting upon the multiplicity of duty; the main thing, the only saving thing, is that always, in relation to his own life, a man is not his uncle but his father.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Let me illustrate what I mean through an example.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For this I take an impression I have retained from my earliest childhood.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: When I was five years of age I was placed in a school.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: That such an event always makes an impression on a child is natural, but the question is what impression.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Childish curiosity is absorbed by its various confused conceptions of what this event can really mean.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Quite reasonably, that was also the case with me; however, the main impression I received was a quite different one.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I made my appearance at school, was presented to the teacher, and was then given as homework for the following day the first ten lines of Balle’s textbook, which I was to learn by heart.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: All other impressions were now wiped from my soul, the only thing that stood out vividly before it was my assignment.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: As a child I had a very good memory.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I soon learned the lines.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: My sister had heard me several times and assured me that I knew them.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I went to bed and before falling asleep tested myself once more.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I fell asleep with the firm intention of reading them over again next morning.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I awoke at five o’clock, I put on my clothes, got hold of my textbook and read again.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Everything still stands before me in that moment so vividly, as though it were yesterday.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For me it was as though heaven and earth would collapse if I were not to learn my lines, and on the other hand it seemed as though even if heaven and earth did collapse, that would in no way exempt me from my assignment once I had it, to learn my lines.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: At that age I had very little idea of my duties; after all, I still had not learned them from Balle’s textbook.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I had just one duty, to learn my homework, and nevertheless from this impression I can derive the whole of my ethical view of life.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I may smile at a small urchin of five like that tackling something with that passion, and yet I assure you, I have no higher wish than that, at any time of life, I may take on my work with the same energy, the same ethical seriousness, as then.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It is true that later in life one gets a better idea of what one’s work is, but the main thing is still the energy.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: That this event made such an impression on me I owe to my father’s serious-mindedness, and if I owed him nothing else, this would be enough to put me eternally in his debt.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In education what matters is not that the child learns this or that, but that the spirit is matured, that energy is aroused.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You often talk of how splendid a thing it is to have a good mind.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Who will deny the importance of that?
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: And yet, I almost think one makes that for oneself if one wants.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Give a man energy, passion, and he has everything.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Take a young girl, let her be silly, hysterical, a real chatterbox, imagine her falling deeply and sincerely in love and you will see that the good mind comes of itself, you will see how shrewd and cunning she becomes in finding out if her love is requited; let her be happy in love and you will see ardour bloom on her lips; let her be unhappy and you will hear the cool reflections of wit and understanding.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So what matters is the energy with which I become ethically conscious, or rather, without energy I cannot become ethically conscious.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I can therefore never be ethically conscious without becoming conscious of my eternal being.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: That is the true proof of the immortality of the soul.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Of course, it is only a fully-fledged proof when the task is congruent with the commitment, but that to which I am eternally committed is an eternal task.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The circumstance that the first ten lines of Balle’s textbook were given me as an assignment from which nothing else in the world could ransom me was then, in a sense, the first proof produced for me of the immortality of my soul.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The incompleteness of the proof lay not in my energy but in the accidental nature of the task.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So I have no intention of initiating you into a consideration of the multiplicity of duties; if I were to express duty negatively that would be easily done; if I were to express it positively it would be very difficult and tedious, indeed beyond a certain point impossible.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: What has been my intention, on the other hand, and what I have tried to the best of my ability to do, is to illuminate the absolute importance of duty, the eternal validity of the relationship of duty for personal being.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For as soon as one’s personal being finds itself in despair, chooses itself absolutely, repents itself, one has oneself as one’s task under an eternal responsibility, and thus duty is posited in its absoluteness.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Since, however, one’s personal being has not created itself but chosen itself, duty is the expression of the identity of its absolute dependency and absolute freedom.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: One will teach oneself the particular duty and seek enlightenment on it from any other man in vain, and yet here too he will be autodidact by virtue of being theodidact,42 and vice versa.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In any case, duty for him will not be something abstract, partly because it is not something outside him, for in that case it is always abstract, partly because he is himself concrete, for in choosing himself ethically he chose himself in all his concretion and renounced the abstraction of the arbitrary.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: It remains to show what life looks like when regarded ethically.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You and all aestheticists are quite prepared to go shares, you admit the ethical has its importance, you say it is respectable for a man to live for his duties, that it is commendable, indeed you even let fall some innuendos about its being right and proper that there are people who live for their duties, that it is as well the majority do that, and you sometimes run across men of duty good-natured enough to find sense in this talk, in spite of the fact, of course, that like all scepticism it is nonsense.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You yourselves, on the other hand, have no wish to embark upon the ethical; that would deprive life of its meaning and above all of its beauty.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The ethical is something quite different from the aesthetic, and once it emerges it altogether destroys the latter.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: – Now, if that were so I would still be in no doubt which to choose.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In despair it appears to be like that for an instant, and the despair of someone who has not so felt it has been fraudulent all along and he has not chosen himself ethically.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But that is not how it is, and therefore, in the next instant, despair proves not to be a breach but a metamorphosis.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Everything returns, but transfigured.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So only when life is regarded ethically does it acquire beauty, truth, meaning, substance; only when one lives ethically does one’s own life acquire beauty, truth, meaning, security; and only in the ethical view of life can self-directed or other-directed doubts about the meaning of a life be put to rest.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Doubts of either kind can only be appeased by one and the same thing, since essentially they are the same doubt.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For autopathic doubt is not a manifestation of egoism but a requirement of the self-love that has the interest of its own self at heart in just the same way as it has that of any other.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This, I think, is of great importance.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If it were not the case that an aestheticist is an egoist, and all conceivable favours were to fall to his lot, he would have to say, ‘What my happiness is due to is something another person can’t be given in the same way, and something no other person can acquire on his own account.’ He would have to be anxious, indeed, in case someone asked him what it was he sought happiness in, since he would in fact have achieved it in order that everyone else should feel that they could not.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If such a person had any sympathy he would spare himself no rest until he had found for his life some higher point of departure.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Having found it, he would not be afraid to speak of his good fortune, for then if he were to give proper voice to it, he would say something that reconciled him absolutely with every human being, with the whole of humankind.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Let us nevertheless stay a moment with the category which aesthetics always champion – beauty.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Life, you say, loses its beauty once the ethical comes into its own.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: ‘Instead of the joy, happiness, unconcern, beauty that life has when we regard it aesthetically, we get conscientious effectiveness, commendable industry, tireless and unremitting zeal.’ If you were here with me now, I would ask you for a definition of the beautiful so as to get started.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Seeing you are not, I will permit myself to draw on a definition that you are in the habit of giving: ‘The beautiful is that which has its teleology within itself.’ You take a young girl, you say, ‘She is beautiful, she is joyful, carefree, happy, in perfect harmony, complete in herself, and it is foolish to ask why she exists, for she has her teleology within her.’ I won’t quibble by objecting that it might not really be to the girl’s advantage to have her teleology within her, all alone in this way, or that, if granted the opportunity to expound your view of the divinity of her existence, you might well flatter yourself that she would eventually fail to appreciate the fact and believe she only existed to listen to your ingratiations.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You look upon nature and find it equally beautiful, and are ready to anathematize every finite view of it.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Neither shall I vex you here with the observation that it might be an essential property of nature to be for-another.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You look upon the works of art and poetry and cry out with the poet: ‘Procul o, procul este, profani’,43 and understand by profani those who would degrade poetry and art by giving them a teleology that lies outside them.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: As far as art and poetry are concerned I will remind you of what I have remarked previously, that they give only an imperfect reconciliation with life, and also that when you fix your gaze on poetry and art it is not reality you are looking upon, and that is what we should really be talking about.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: We return again to that, then, and since you yourself presumably perceive that were you to apply the requirements of art in all their strictness, you would most likely find precious little beauty in life; you are giving the beautiful another meaning.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The beautiful you talk of is the individually beautiful.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: You see each single individual as a little element in the whole, see him precisely in his particularity, and in this way even the accidental, the insignificant, acquires significance and life itself the imprint of beauty.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So you look on each person as an element.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: But the beautiful was supposed to be that which had its teleology in itself, yet when a man is just an element his teleology is indeed not inside but outside him.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So even if the whole is beautiful, the parts in themselves are not.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: When you define the beautiful as that which has its teleology within it and then offer as examples a young girl, or nature, or a work of art, I feel forced to conclude that all this talk of their having their teleology within them is an illusion.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: To talk of teleology at all there must be a movement, for whenever I think of a goal I think of a movement, and even if I think of someone who has reached the goal I still always think of a movement, for I think of his having got there through a movement.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: What you call beautiful manifestly lacks movement, for the beautiful in nature exists all at once, and when I look at a work of art and penetrate its thought with mine, really the movement occurs in me, not in the work of art.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So you may well be right in saying that beauty has its teleology within it, but in the way you grasp this and apply it, it is really only a negative expression indicating that the beautiful does not have its teleology in something else.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Therefore you will not be able, either, to use an apparently synonymous expression, that the beautiful you talk about has an inner teleology or an immanent teleology.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: For as soon as you use it you require movement, history, and you have thereby gone beyond the spheres of nature and art and are in that of freedom, and so of ethics.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If I say now that the individual has his teleology within him, this cannot be misunderstood as implying that I take the individual to be the central thing, or that the individual in an abstract sense is sufficient unto himself, for after all if he is grasped abstractly I get no movement.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: The individual has his teleology within him, has an inner teleology, is himself his own teleology, and his self, then, is the goal for which he strives.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: This self of his is not, however, an abstraction, but absolutely concrete.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In the movement towards himself he cannot relate himself negatively to the world around him, for his self would then be an abstraction and remain such.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He must open his self in respect of his whole concretion, but to that concretion also belong those factors specifically to do with taking an active part in the world.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: So his movement will be from himself, through the world, to himself.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Also, the movement here is a real movement, for this movement is the work of freedom but at the same time immanent teleology, and it is here, therefore, that there can first be any question of beauty.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: In that case, the individual comes in a sense to stand higher than any relationship, but it does not at all follow that he is not in this relationship; nor can anything tyrannical be discerned in this, since after all the same applies to every individual.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I am a married man and you know I have the deepest respect for this relationship, and I know that with all love I humble myself before it; yet I know that in another sense I am higher than this relationship but I also know that exactly the same applies to my wife.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Therefore only when I look upon life ethically do I see it with regard to its beauty, only when I look upon my own life ethically do I see it with regard to its beauty.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: And if you say that this beauty is invisible, I reply, ‘In a sense it is, in another sense it is not since it can be seen in the trace of the historical, seen as when it is said, Loquere ut videam te.’44 True enough; what I see is not the consummation but the struggle, but I do see the struggle all the same, whenever I want to if I have the courage, and without courage I see nothing eternal at all, and consequently nothing beautiful either.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: When I look upon life ethically I look at it in respect of its beauty.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: To me life then becomes rich in beauty, not poor, as it really does for you.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I do not have to travel all over the country to discover beauties, or scrape around for them on the streets, I do not have to size up and reject.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: Well, that is natural, I do not have as much time as you either, for when I have a regard – with pleasure though also with seriousness – for the beauty in my own life, there is always enough for me to do.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: If occasionally I have an hour free I stand at my window and look at people, and I have a regard for the beauty of each one.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: However insignificant and humble he may be I see him with a view to his beauty, for I see him as this individual person who is at the same time the universal man; I see him as the one with that concrete task in life; he is not there for the sake of any other person, even if he were the humblest hired waiter; he has his teleology within him, he realizes that task – he triumphs, that’s what I see; for the man of courage does not see ghosts, on the contrary he sees conquering heroes; while the coward does not see heroes but only ghosts.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: He is bound to conquer, of that I am certain, therefore his struggle is beautiful.
chapter_text: Equilibrium Between the Aesthetic and the Ethical in the Development of Personality

sentence: I am not as a rule much disposed to struggle, not at least with others than myself.
